required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety of Deferasirox in Non-transfusion Dependent Thalassemia Patients With Iron Overload and a One Year Open-label Extension Study
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled, Phase II Study to Evaluate Efficacy and Safety of Deferasirox in Non-transfusion-dependent Thalassemia Patients With Iron Overload

brief_summary.textblock:
CICL670A2209: This study will evaluate the safety and efficacy of deferasirox in non-transfusion dependent thalassemia patients with iron overload. Patients will be treated either with active treatment (deferasirox) or placebo for 12 months (core study phase). Patients who complete the core study phase will be offered to continue their study with the active treatment (deferasirox) in a 12 months extension phase. During the core and extension, the effects of treatment on iron overload in the liver will be evaluated using magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) assessments.
CICL670A2209E1: A one-year open-label extension to a randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled, phase II study to evaluate efficacy and safety of deferasirox in non-transfusion dependent thalassemia patients with iron overload (Thalassa).

primary_outcome.measure: Core Study: Change in Liver Iron Concentration (LIC) From Baseline to Week 52
primary_outcome.description: LIC was measured by magnetic resonance imaging technique at baseline and Week 52. Estimates were obtained from an Analysis of Covariance (ANCOVA) model for change in LIC between baseline and Week 52 with treatment as factor and baseline LIC as covariate.

primary_outcome.measure: Extension Study: Percentage of Participants Reaching a Liver Iron Concentration (LIC) < 5 mg Fe/g dw From Core Baseline to End of Extension Study
primary_outcome.time_frame: Core Baseline to End of Extension Study (up to 24 months)
primary_outcome.description: Liver iron concentration was measured at Core Baseline and at the end of the Extension Study. Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) scans were analyzed at a central laboratory to determine the LIC value. The percentage of participants with LIC < 5 mgFe/g dw (milligram iron/gram dry weight) change from Baseline at the end of the Extension Study is reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Core Study: Change in Liver Iron Concentration (LIC) From Baseline to Week 24
secondary_outcome.description: LIC was measured by magnetic resonance imaging technique at baseline and Week 24. Estimates were obtained from an Analysis of Covariance (ANCOVA) model for change in LIC between baseline and Week 24 with treatment as factor and baseline LIC as covariate.

secondary_outcome.measure: Core Study: Change in Serum Ferritin Between Baseline and Fourth Quarter
secondary_outcome.description: Baseline serum ferritin average was the average of all available ferritin values from screening to last sample prior to the first intake of study drug. Fourth quarter serum ferritin average was the average of all serum ferritin values obtained within days 286- End of Study. Change from baseline: fourth quarter serum ferritin average - baseline serum ferritin average.

secondary_outcome.measure: Core Study: Change in Serum Ferritin Between Baseline and Second Quarter
secondary_outcome.description: Baseline serum ferritin average was the average of all available ferritin values from screening to last sample prior to the first intake of study drug. Second quarter serum ferritin average was the average of all serum ferritin values obtained within days 106-195. Change from baseline: second quarter serum ferritin average - baseline serum ferritin average.

secondary_outcome.measure: Core Study: Percentage of Participants With Adverse Events Graded Mild, Moderate and Severe
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of Participants with Mild, Moderate and Severe adverse events (AE) any primary system organ class regardless of study drug relationship. A patient with multiple occurrences of an AE is counted only once in the AE category for that treatment. A patient with multiple severity ratings for an AE while on a treatment is only counted once under the maximum rating.

secondary_outcome.measure: Core Study: Change in Liver Iron Concentration (LIC) From Baseline At Week 24 and Week 52 in Patients With Dose Increases After Week 24
secondary_outcome.description: LIC was measured by magnetic resonance imaging technique at baseline, Week 24 and Week 52. Dose Doubling (Dose Increases) began at Week 24.

secondary_outcome.measure: Core Study: Correlation Between Serum Ferritin and LIC (Liver Iron Concentration)
secondary_outcome.description: The correlation between serum ferritin and LIC was investigated using a scatter plot with a regression line for the following cases: Baseline serum ferritin versus baseline LIC Serum ferritin difference from baseline at fourth quarter versus difference from baseline in LIC at Week 52. A value of 1.0 indicates a perfect correlation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Core Study: Change From Baseline in Hemoglobin at Month 12
secondary_outcome.description: Blood was collected for Hemoglobin at baseline and Month 12. Change from baseline= Month 12 hemoglobin - baseline hemoglobin.

secondary_outcome.measure: Core Study: Change From Baseline in Transferrin Saturation at Month 12
secondary_outcome.description: Blood was collected for transferrin saturation at Baseline and Month 12. Change from baseline= Month 12 transferrin saturation - baseline transferrin saturation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Core Study: Change in Liver Iron Concentration (LIC) in Placebo Patients From Baseline to Week 52
secondary_outcome.description: LIC was measured by magnetic resonance imaging technique at baseline and Week 52. The change in liver iron concentration for participants in the placebo arm was used to assess the iron accumulation rate.

secondary_outcome.measure: Core Study: Percentage of Participants With Notable Abnormal Post-baseline Laboratory Results
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of participants with notable laboratory results: Platelet count: (<100 x 10^9/L) Absolute neutrophils: (<1.5 x 10^9/L) Alanine aminotransferase (ALT): (>5 x Upper limit normal (ULN) and >2 x baseline). Aspartate aminotransferase (AST): (>5 x ULN and >2 x baseline) Serum creatinine: (>33% increase from baseline and >ULN at ≥2 consecutive post-baseline values) Creatinine clearance: (<60 mL/min at ≥2 consecutive post-baseline values) Urinary protein/creatinine ratio: (≥ 1.0 mg/mg at ≥2 consecutive post-baseline values)

secondary_outcome.measure: Core Study: Percentage of Participants With Notably Abnormal Post-baseline Systolic Blood Pressure
secondary_outcome.description: Systolic blood pressure was measured at each visit after the patient rested in the sitting position for at least 3 minutes. A Notably Abnormal Systolic Blood Pressure was defined as a measurement in one of the following two categories: High: ≥180 with an increase from baseline ≥20 mmHg Low: ≤90 with a decrease from baseline ≥20 mmHg

secondary_outcome.measure: Core Study: Percentage of Participants With Notably Abnormal Post-baseline Diastolic Blood Pressure
secondary_outcome.description: Diastolic blood pressure was measured at each visit after the patient rested in the sitting position for at least 3 minutes. A Notably Abnormal Diastolic Blood Pressure was defined as a measurement in one of the following two categories: High: ≥105 with an increase from baseline ≥15 mmHg Low: ≤50 with a decrease from baseline ≥15 mmHg

secondary_outcome.measure: Core Study: Percentage of Participants With Notably Abnormal Post-baseline Pulse Rate
secondary_outcome.description: Pulse Rate was measured at each visit. A Notably Abnormal Pulse Rate was defined as a measurement in one of the following two categories: High: ≥120 with an increase from baseline ≥15 beats per minute (bpm) Low: ≤50 with a decrease from baseline ≥15 bpm

secondary_outcome.measure: Extension Study: Absolute Change in Serum Ferritin From Baseline to Eighth Quarter
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Core Baseline, Eighth Quarter (last 3 months of the study)
secondary_outcome.description: Blood was collected for serum ferritin at Core Baseline and monthly during the Eighth quarter of the Extension Study. Absolute change from Baseline: quarterly average - baseline average. A negative change from baseline indicated improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Extension Study: Change in Liver Iron Concentration (LIC) From Baseline at Month 24
secondary_outcome.description: LIC was measured by magnetic resonance imaging technique at Baseline and Month 24. A negative change from baseline indicated improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Extension Study: Correlation Between Serum Ferritin and LIC (Liver Iron Concentration)
secondary_outcome.description: The correlation between serum ferritin and LIC was investigated using a scatter plot with a regression line for serum ferritin difference from Baseline at Month 24 versus LIC difference from Baseline at Month 24. A value of 1.0 indicates a perfect correlation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Extension Study: Change From Baseline in Hemoglobin at Month 24
secondary_outcome.description: Blood was collected for Hemoglobin at Baseline and Month 24. Change from Baseline= Month 24 hemoglobin - Baseline hemoglobin.

secondary_outcome.measure: Extension Study: Change From Baseline in Transferrin Saturation at Month 24
secondary_outcome.description: Blood was collected for transferrin saturation at Baseline and Month 24. Change from baseline= Month 24 transferrin saturation - baseline transferrin saturation.

arm_group.description: Participants received a starting dose of 5 mg/kg/day deferasirox tablets orally each day in the morning for 52 weeks. After 24 weeks of treatment Liver Iron Concentration (LIC) was assessed. Based on the LIC and change from baseline in LIC participants were eligible for dose escalation. In the Extension Study participants received deferasirox once daily (dose based on LIC) for 52 weeks.

Participants received a starting dose of 10 mg/kg/day deferasirox tablets orally each day in the morning for 52 weeks. After 24 weeks of treatment Liver Iron Concentration (LIC) was assessed. Based on the LIC and change from baseline in LIC participants were eligible for dose escalation. In the Extension Study participants received deferasirox once daily (dose based on LIC) for 52 weeks.

Placebo tablet matching 5 mg/kg/day orally in the morning each day for 52 weeks. After 24 weeks of treatment Liver Iron Concentration (LIC) was assessed. Based on the LIC and change from baseline in LIC participants were eligible for dose escalation. In the Extension Study participants received deferasirox once daily (dose based on LIC) for 52 weeks.

Placebo tablet matching 10 mg/kg/day orally in the morning each day for 52 weeks. After 24 weeks of treatment Liver Iron Concentration (LIC) was assessed. Based on the LIC and change from baseline in LIC participants were eligible for dose escalation. In the Extension Study participants received deferasirox once daily (dose based on LIC) for 52 weeks.

intervention.description: Supplied as 125 mg, 250 mg and 500 mg tablets.
Supplied as matching 125 mg, 250 mg and 500 mg tablets.

criteria.textblock:
Core Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or female aged ≥ 10 years with non-transfusion dependent syndromes, not requiring transfusion within 6 months prior to study start. Note: there was a local country amendment for Greece only to change the age specific inclusion criteria to ≥ 18 years old
- Liver iron concentration ≥ 5 mg/g dry weight measured by Magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) before study start
- Serum ferritin >300 ng/mL at screening
Core Exclusion Criteria:
- Hemoglobin S (HbS)-variants of thalassemia syndromes
- Anticipated regular transfusion program during the study. Patients having a sporadic transfusion (e.g. in case of infection) throughout the study course will not be excluded
- Any blood transfusion 6 months prior to study start
- Creatinine clearance ≤ 60 mL/min at screening
- Serum creatinine above the upper limit of normal at both screening visits
- Significant proteinuria as indicated by a urine protein/urine creatinine ratio > 1.0 mg/mg
- Alanine aminotransferase (ALT) of > 5 x the upper limit of normal at both screening visits
- Concomitant therapy with hydroxyurea, erythropoietin, butyrate
- History of deferasirox treatment
- Pediatric patients: a patient's weight of below 20 kg
Extension Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients who completed the core CICL670A2209 clinical trial
- Written informed consent obtained prior entry to one year extension study CICL670A2209
Extension Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with a continuous increase in serum creatinine ≥ 33% above the baseline value and > ULN who did not improve after drug interruption or dose reduction in the core study
- Patients with a continuous increase in ALT greater than 2 times the baseline value and > 5 times ULN who did not improve after drug interruption or dose reduction in the core study
- Patients with progressive proteinuria, as assessed by the investigator, who did not improve after drug interruption or dose reduction in the core study
- Significant medical condition interfering with the ability to partake in this study (e.g.systemic uncontrolled hypertension, unstable cardiac disease not controlled by standard medical therapy, systemic disease (cardiovascular, renal, hepatic, etc.)
Other protocol-defined inclusion/exclusion criteria may apply

facility.name: New York Presbyterian Hospital/Weill Medical College of Cornell University

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: There was a 4 week screening period to determine eligibility prior to randomization.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Age, Customized
Gender

outcome.title: Core Study: Change in Liver Iron Concentration (LIC) From Baseline to Week 24
outcome.description: LIC was measured by magnetic resonance imaging technique at baseline and Week 24. Estimates were obtained from an Analysis of Covariance (ANCOVA) model for change in LIC between baseline and Week 24 with treatment as factor and baseline LIC as covariate.
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set. The last available post-baseline LIC was carried forward if no LIC value was available at Week 24. Only patients with both baseline and at least one post-baseline value were included for this analysis.

group.title: 5 mg/kg/Day Deferasirox
group.description: Participants received a starting dose of 5 mg/kg/day deferasirox tablets orally each day in the morning for 52 weeks. After 24 weeks of treatment Liver Iron Concentration (LIC) was assessed. Based on the LIC and change from baseline in LIC participants were eligible for dose escalation.

group.title: Placebo

measure.title: Core Study: Change in Liver Iron Concentration (LIC) From Baseline to Week 24
measure.description: LIC was measured by magnetic resonance imaging technique at baseline and Week 24. Estimates were obtained from an Analysis of Covariance (ANCOVA) model for change in LIC between baseline and Week 24 with treatment as factor and baseline LIC as covariate.
measure.population: Full Analysis Set. The last available post-baseline LIC was carried forward if no LIC value was available at Week 24. Only patients with both baseline and at least one post-baseline value were included for this analysis.

outcome.title: Core Study: Change in Serum Ferritin Between Baseline and Fourth Quarter
outcome.description: Baseline serum ferritin average was the average of all available ferritin values from screening to last sample prior to the first intake of study drug. Fourth quarter serum ferritin average was the average of all serum ferritin values obtained within days 286- End of Study. Change from baseline: fourth quarter serum ferritin average - baseline serum ferritin average.
outcome.population: Full Analysis set (all randomized patients). Only participants with both baseline and post-baseline values are included in analyses. If serum ferritin was missing during the fourth quarter, the last available average of serum ferritin per quarter was used for the calculation of the change from baseline.

group.description: Participants received a starting dose of 5 mg/kg/day deferasirox tablets orally each day in the morning for 52 weeks. A patient with multiple occurrences of an AE is counted only once in the AE category for that treatment. A patient with multiple severity ratings for an AE while on a treatment is only counted once under the maximum rating.
outcome.population: Safety Analysis Set included all randomized participants who received treatment.

outcome.title: Core Study: Change in Liver Iron Concentration (LIC) From Baseline At Week 24 and Week 52 in Patients With Dose Increases After Week 24
outcome.description: LIC was measured by magnetic resonance imaging technique at baseline, Week 24 and Week 52. Dose Doubling (Dose Increases) began at Week 24.
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set. The last available post-baseline LIC was carried forward if no LIC value was available at Week 24 and Week 52. Only patients with dose increases after week 24, with both baseline and at least one post-baseline value were included for this analysis.

group.title: 5 mg/kg/Day Deferasirox

measure.title: Core Study: Change in Liver Iron Concentration (LIC) From Baseline At Week 24 and Week 52 in Patients With Dose Increases After Week 24

measure.population: Full Analysis Set. The last available post-baseline LIC was carried forward if no LIC value was available at Week 24 and Week 52. Only patients with dose increases after week 24, with both baseline and at least one post-baseline value were included for this analysis.

outcome.title: Core Study: Correlation Between Serum Ferritin and LIC (Liver Iron Concentration)
outcome.description: The correlation between serum ferritin and LIC was investigated using a scatter plot with a regression line for the following cases: Baseline serum ferritin versus baseline LIC Serum ferritin difference from baseline at fourth quarter versus difference from baseline in LIC at Week 52. A value of 1.0 indicates a perfect correlation.
outcome.population: Participants from the Full Analysis Set (all randomized participants).

group.title: All Randomized Participants
group.description: Participants received a starting dose of 5 mg/kg/day or 10 mg/kg/day deferasirox tablets or matching placebo orally each day in the morning for 52 weeks. measure.population: Safety Analysis Set. The last available post-baseline LIC was carried forward if no LIC value was available at Week 52. Only patients with both baseline and at least one post-baseline value were included for this analysis.

outcome.title: Core Study: Percentage of Participants With Notable Abnormal Post-baseline Laboratory Results
outcome.description: The percentage of participants with notable laboratory results: Platelet count: (<100 x 10^9/L) Absolute neutrophils: (<1.5 x 10^9/L) Alanine aminotransferase (ALT): (>5 x Upper limit normal (ULN) and >2 x baseline). Aspartate aminotransferase (AST): (>5 x ULN and >2 x baseline) Serum creatinine: (>33% increase from baseline and >ULN at ≥2 consecutive post-baseline values) Creatinine clearance: (<60 mL/min at ≥2 consecutive post-baseline values) Urinary protein/creatinine ratio: (≥ 1.0 mg/mg at ≥2 consecutive post-baseline values)
outcome.population: Safety Set included all randomized participants who received treatment.

group.title: 5 mg/kg/Day Deferasirox
group.description: Participants received a starting dose of 5 mg/kg/day deferasirox tablets orally each day in the morning for 52 weeks. After 24 weeks of treatment Liver Iron Concentration (LIC) was assessed. Based on the LIC and change from baseline in LIC participants were eligible for dose escalation.

group.title: 10 mg/kg/Day Deferasirox
group.description: Participants received a starting dose of 10 mg/kg/day deferasirox tablets orally each day in the morning for 52 weeks. After 24 weeks of treatment Liver Iron Concentration (LIC) was assessed. Based on the LIC and change from baseline in LIC participants were eligible for dose escalation.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Placebo tablet matching 5 mg/kg/day or 10 mg/kg/day orally in the morning each day for 52 weeks. Participants received a starting dose of 5 mg/kg/day deferasirox tablets orally each day in the morning for 52 weeks. After 24 weeks of treatment Liver Iron Concentration (LIC) was assessed. Based on the LIC and change from baseline in LIC participants were eligible for dose escalation.

measure.title: Core Study: Percentage of Participants With Notable Abnormal Post-baseline Laboratory Results
measure.description: The percentage of participants with notable laboratory results: Platelet count: (<100 x 10^9/L) Absolute neutrophils: (<1.5 x 10^9/L) Alanine aminotransferase (ALT): (>5 x Upper limit normal (ULN) and >2 x baseline). Aspartate aminotransferase (AST): (>5 x ULN and >2 x baseline) Serum creatinine: (>33% increase from baseline and >ULN at ≥2 consecutive post-baseline values) Creatinine clearance: (<60 mL/min at ≥2 consecutive post-baseline values) Urinary protein/creatinine ratio: (≥ 1.0 mg/mg at ≥2 consecutive post-baseline values)
measure.population: Safety Set included all randomized participants who received treatment.

outcome.title: Core Study: Change in Liver Iron Concentration (LIC) From Baseline to Week 52
outcome.description: LIC was measured by magnetic resonance imaging technique at baseline and Week 52. Estimates were obtained from an Analysis of Covariance (ANCOVA) model for change in LIC between baseline and Week 52 with treatment as factor and baseline LIC as covariate.
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set. The last available post-baseline LIC was carried forward if no LIC value was available at Week 52. Only patients with both baseline and at least one post-baseline value were included for this analysis.

group.title: 5 mg/kg/Day Deferasirox
group.description: Participants received a starting dose of 5 mg/kg/day deferasirox tablets orally each day in the morning for 52 weeks. After 24 weeks of treatment Liver Iron Concentration (LIC) was assessed. Based on the LIC and change from baseline in LIC participants were eligible for dose escalation.

group.title: 10 mg/kg/Day Deferasirox
group.description: Participants received a starting dose of 10 mg/kg/day deferasirox tablets orally each day in the morning for 52 weeks. After 24 weeks of treatment Liver Iron Concentration (LIC) was assessed. Based on the LIC and change from baseline in LIC participants were eligible for dose escalation.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Placebo tablet matching 5 mg/kg/day or 10 mg/kg/day orally in the morning each day for 52 weeks. After 24 weeks of treatment Liver Iron Concentration (LIC) was assessed. Based on the LIC and change from baseline in LIC participants were eligible for dose escalation.

measure.title: Core Study: Change in Liver Iron Concentration (LIC) From Baseline to Week 52
measure.description: LIC was measured by magnetic resonance imaging technique at baseline and Week 52. Estimates were obtained from an Analysis of Covariance (ANCOVA) model for change in LIC between baseline and Week 52 with treatment as factor and baseline LIC as covariate.
measure.population: Full Analysis Set. The last available post-baseline LIC was carried forward if no LIC value was available at Week 52. Only patients with both baseline and at least one post-baseline value were included for this analysis.

outcome.title: Core Study: Percentage of Participants With Notably Abnormal Post-baseline Systolic Blood Pressure
outcome.description: Systolic blood pressure was measured at each visit after the patient rested in the sitting position for at least 3 minutes. A Notably Abnormal Systolic Blood Pressure was defined as a measurement in one of the following two categories: High: ≥180 with an increase from baseline ≥20 mmHg Low: ≤90 with a decrease from baseline ≥20 mmHg
outcome.population: Safety Set includes all randomized participants who received treatment.

group.title: 5 mg/kg/Day Deferasirox
group.description: Participants received a starting dose of 5 mg/kg/day deferasirox tablets orally each day in the morning for 52 weeks. After 24 weeks of treatment Liver Iron Concentration (LIC) was assessed. Based on the LIC and change from baseline in LIC participants were eligible for dose escalation.

group.description: Participants received a starting dose of 10 mg/kg/day deferasirox tablets orally each day in the morning for 52 weeks. After 24 weeks of treatment Liver Iron Concentration (LIC) was assessed. Based on the LIC and change from baseline in LIC participants were eligible for dose escalation.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Placebo tablet matching 5 mg/kg/day or 10 mg/kg/day orally in the morning each day for 52 weeks. Participants received a starting dose of 5 or 10 mg/kg/day deferasirox tablets orally each day in the morning for 52 weeks. After 24 weeks of treatment Liver Iron Concentration (LIC) was assessed. Based on the LIC and change from baseline in LIC participants were eligible for dose escalation.

measure.title: Core Study: Percentage of Participants With Notably Abnormal Post-baseline Systolic Blood Pressure
measure.description: Systolic blood pressure was measured at each visit after the patient rested in the sitting position for at least 3 minutes. A Notably Abnormal Systolic Blood Pressure was defined as a measurement in one of the following two categories: High: ≥180 with an increase from baseline ≥20 mmHg Low: ≤90 with a decrease from baseline ≥20 mmHg
measure.population: Safety Set includes all randomized participants who received treatment.

outcome.title: Core Study: Percentage of Participants With Notably Abnormal Post-baseline Diastolic Blood Pressure
outcome.description: Diastolic blood pressure was measured at each visit after the patient rested in the sitting position for at least 3 minutes. A Notably Abnormal Diastolic Blood Pressure was defined as a measurement in one of the following two categories: High: ≥105 with an increase from baseline ≥15 mmHg Low: ≤50 with a decrease from baseline ≥15 mmHg
outcome.population: Safety Set includes all randomized participants who received treatment.

A Notably Abnormal Diastolic Blood Pressure was defined as a measurement in one of the following two categories: High: ≥105 with an increase from baseline ≥15 mmHg Low: ≤50 with a decrease from baseline ≥15 mmHg
measure.population: Safety Set includes all randomized participants who received treatment.

outcome.title: Core Study: Percentage of Participants With Notably Abnormal Post-baseline Pulse Rate
outcome.description: Pulse Rate was measured at each visit. A Notably Abnormal Pulse Rate was defined as a measurement in one of the following two categories: High: ≥120 with an increase from baseline ≥15 beats per minute (bpm) Low: ≤50 with a decrease from baseline ≥15 bpm
outcome.population: Safety Set includes all randomized participants who received treatment.

group.title: 5 mg/kg/Day Deferasirox
group.description: Participants received a starting dose of 5 mg/kg/day deferasirox tablets orally each day in the morning for 52 weeks. After 24 weeks of treatment Liver Iron Concentration (LIC) was assessed. Based on the LIC and change from baseline in LIC participants were eligible for dose escalation.

group.title: 10 mg/kg/Day Deferasirox
group.description: Participants received a starting dose of 10 mg/kg/day deferasirox tablets orally each day in the morning for 52 weeks. After 24 weeks of treatment Liver Iron Concentration (LIC) was assessed. Based on the LIC and change from baseline in LIC participants were eligible for dose escalation.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Placebo tablet matching 5 mg/kg/day or 10 mg/kg/day orally in the morning each day for 52 weeks. Participants received a starting dose of 5 or 10 mg/kg/day deferasirox tablets orally each day in the morning for 52 weeks. After 24 weeks of treatment Liver Iron Concentration (LIC) was assessed. Based on the LIC and change from baseline in LIC participants were eligible for dose escalation.

measure.title: Core Study: Percentage of Participants With Notably Abnormal Post-baseline Pulse Rate
measure.description: Pulse Rate was measured at each visit. A Notably Abnormal Pulse Rate was defined as a measurement in one of the following two categories: High: ≥120 with an increase from baseline ≥15 beats per minute (bpm) Low: ≤50 with a decrease from baseline ≥15 bpm
measure.population: Safety Set includes all randomized participants who received treatment.

outcome.title: Extension Study: Absolute Change in Serum Ferritin From Baseline to Eighth Quarter
outcome.description: Blood was collected for serum ferritin at Core Baseline and monthly during the Eighth quarter of the Extension Study. Absolute change from Baseline: quarterly average – baseline average. A negative change from baseline indicated improvement.
outcome.time_frame: Core Baseline, Eighth Quarter (last 3 months of the study)
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set included all randomized participants. Only patients with a value both at baseline and at considered time point are included.

group.title: Deferasirox
group.description: Participants received a starting dose of 5 mg/kg/day or 10 mg/kg/day deferasirox tablets orally each day in the morning for 52 weeks. After 24 weeks of treatment Liver Iron Concentration (LIC) was assessed. Based on the LIC and change from baseline in LIC participants were eligible for dose escalation. In the Extension Study participants received deferasirox once daily (dose based on LIC) for 52 weeks.

group.title: Placebo/Deferasirox
group.description: Placebo tablet matching 5 mg/kg/day or 10 mg/kg/day orally in the morning each day for 52 weeks. After 24 weeks of treatment Liver Iron Concentration (LIC) was assessed. Based on the LIC and change from baseline in LIC participants were eligible for dose escalation. In the Extension Study participants received deferasirox once daily (dose based on LIC) for 52 weeks.

measure.title: Extension Study: Absolute Change in Serum Ferritin From Baseline to Eighth Quarter
measure.description: Blood was collected for serum ferritin at Core Baseline and monthly during the Eighth quarter of the Extension Study. Absolute change from Baseline: quarterly average – baseline average. A negative change from baseline indicated improvement.
measure.population: Full Analysis Set included all randomized participants. Only patients with a value both at baseline and at considered time point are included.

outcome.title: Extension Study: Percentage of Participants Reaching a Liver Iron Concentration (LIC) < 5 mg Fe/g dw From Core Baseline to End of Extension Study
outcome.description: Liver iron concentration was measured at Core Baseline and at the end of the Extension Study. Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) scans were analyzed at a central laboratory to determine the LIC value. The percentage of participants with LIC < 5 mgFe/g dw (milligram iron/gram dry weight) change from Baseline at the end of the Extension Study is reported.
outcome.time_frame: Core Baseline to End of Extension Study (up to 24 months)
outcome.population: Full Analysis consisted of all randomized participants. Patients with post-baseline LIC satisfying criterion at any time during the study are counted as responder. Patients with no baseline LIC or without any post-baseline LIC measurements will be assumed as non-responder.

group.title: Deferasirox
group.description: Participants received a starting dose of 5 mg/kg/day or 10 mg/kg/day deferasirox tablets orally each day in the morning for 52 weeks. After 24 weeks of treatment Liver Iron Concentration (LIC) was assessed. Based on the LIC and change from baseline in LIC participants were eligible for dose escalation. In the Extension Study participants received deferasirox once daily (dose based on LIC) for 52 weeks.

group.title: Placebo/Deferasirox
group.description: Placebo tablet matching 5 mg/kg/day or 10 mg/kg/day orally in the morning each day for 52 weeks. After 24 weeks of treatment Liver Iron Concentration (LIC) was assessed. Based on the LIC and change from baseline in LIC participants were eligible for dose escalation. In the Extension Study participants received deferasirox once daily (dose based on LIC) for 52 weeks.

measure.title: Extension Study: Percentage of Participants Reaching a Liver Iron Concentration (LIC) < 5 mg Fe/g dw From Core Baseline to End of Extension Study
measure.description: Liver iron concentration was measured at Core Baseline and at the end of the Extension Study. Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) scans were analyzed at a central laboratory to determine the LIC value. The percentage of participants with LIC < 5 mgFe/g dw (milligram iron/gram dry weight) change from Baseline at the end of the Extension Study is reported.
measure.population: Full Analysis consisted of all randomized participants. Patients with post-baseline LIC satisfying criterion at any time during the study are counted as responder. Patients with no baseline LIC or without any post-baseline LIC measurements will be assumed as non-responder.

outcome.title: Extension Study: Change in Liver Iron Concentration (LIC) From Baseline at Month 24
outcome.description: LIC was measured by magnetic resonance imaging technique at Baseline and Month 24. A negative change from baseline indicated improvement.
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set. The last available post-baseline LIC was carried forward if no LIC value was available at Week 52. Only patients with both baseline and at least one post-baseline value were included for this analysis.

group.title: Deferasirox
group.description: Participants received a starting dose of 5 mg/kg/day or 10 mg/kg/day deferasirox tablets orally each day in the morning for 52 weeks. After 24 weeks of treatment Liver Iron Concentration (LIC) was assessed. Based on the LIC and change from baseline in LIC participants were eligible for dose escalation. In the Extension Study participants received deferasirox once daily (dose based on LIC) for 52 weeks.

group.title: Placebo/Deferasirox
group.description: Placebo tablet matching 5 mg/kg/day or 10 mg/kg/day orally in the morning each day for 52 weeks. After 24 weeks of treatment Liver Iron Concentration (LIC) was assessed. Based on the LIC and change from baseline in LIC participants were eligible for dose escalation. In the Extension Study participants received deferasirox once daily (dose based on LIC) for 52 weeks.

measure.title: Extension Study: Change in Liver Iron Concentration (LIC) From Baseline at Month 24
measure.description: LIC was measured by magnetic resonance imaging technique at Baseline and Month 24. A negative change from baseline indicated improvement.
measure.population: Full Analysis Set. The last available post-baseline LIC was carried forward if no LIC value was available at Week 52. Only patients with both baseline and at least one post-baseline value were included for this analysis.

outcome.title: Extension Study: Correlation Between Serum Ferritin and LIC (Liver Iron Concentration)
outcome.description: The correlation between serum ferritin and LIC was investigated using a scatter plot with a regression line for serum ferritin difference from Baseline at Month 24 versus LIC difference from Baseline at Month 24. A value of 1.0 indicates a perfect correlation.
outcome.population: Participants from the Extension Full Analysis Set (all randomized participants)in the Extension Study with data available for analysis.

group.title: All Randomized Participants
group.description: Participants received a starting dose of 5 mg/kg/day or 10 mg/kg/day deferasirox tablets or matching placebo orally each day in the morning for 52 weeks. After 24 weeks of treatment Liver Iron Concentration (LIC) was assessed. Based on the LIC and change from baseline in LIC participants were eligible for dose escalation.

measure.title: Extension Study: Correlation Between Serum Ferritin and LIC (Liver Iron Concentration)
measure.description: The correlation between serum ferritin and LIC was investigated using a scatter plot with a regression line for serum ferritin difference from Baseline at Month 24 versus LIC difference from Baseline at Month 24. A value of 1.0 indicates a perfect correlation.
measure.population: Participants from the Extension Full Analysis Set (all randomized participants)in the Extension Study with data available for analysis.

outcome.title: Extension Study: Change From Baseline in Hemoglobin at Month 24
outcome.description: Blood was collected for Hemoglobin at Baseline and Month 24. Change from Baseline= Month 24 hemoglobin - Baseline hemoglobin.
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set (all randomized participants). Only patients with a value both at baseline and at considered timepoint are included in analyses.

group.title: Deferasirox
group.description: Participants received a starting dose of 5 mg/kg/day deferasirox tablets orally each day in the morning for 52 weeks. After 24 weeks of treatment Liver Iron Concentration (LIC) was assessed. Based on the LIC and change from baseline in LIC participants were eligible for dose escalation. In the Extension Study participants received deferasirox once daily (dose based on LIC) for 52 weeks.

group.title: Placebo/Deferasirox
group.description: Placebo tablet matching 5 mg/kg/day or 10 mg/kg/day orally in the morning each day for 52 weeks. After 24 weeks of treatment Liver Iron Concentration (LIC) was assessed. Based on the LIC and change from baseline in LIC participants were eligible for dose escalation. In the Extension Study participants received deferasirox once daily (dose based on LIC) for 52 weeks.

measure.title: Extension Study: Change From Baseline in Hemoglobin at Month 24
measure.description: Blood was collected for Hemoglobin at Baseline and Month 24. Change from Baseline= Month 24 hemoglobin - Baseline hemoglobin.
measure.population: Full Analysis Set (all randomized participants). Only patients with a value both at baseline and at considered timepoint are included in analyses.

outcome.title: Extension Study: Change From Baseline in Transferrin Saturation at Month 24
outcome.description: Blood was collected for transferrin saturation at Baseline and Month 24. Change from baseline= Month 24 transferrin saturation - baseline transferrin saturation.
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set (all randomized patients). Only patients with a value both at baseline and at considered timepoint are included in the analyses.

Based on the LIC and change from baseline in LIC participants were eligible for dose escalation. In the Extension Study participants received deferasirox once daily (dose based on LIC) for 52 weeks.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The terms and conditions of Novartis' agreements with its investigators may vary. However, Novartis does not prohibit any investigator from publishing. Any publications from a single-site are postponed until the publication of the pooled data (i.e., data from all sites) in the clinical trial.
